title: Murdered on the school run: The controversial Ukrainian gunned down in Madrid
content: The killing in a Madrid suburb has shocked Ukrainians, but has not triggered an outpouring of grief.

title: Russia launches largest drone attack yet on Ukraine
content: Twelve people were reported killed in Ukraine, with its air force saying 22 locations were hit by Russian air strikes.

title: North Korea makes arrests over botched ship launch
content: Kim Jong Un said those who made "irresponsible errors" would be dealt with at a plenary meeting next month.

title: Israeli strike kills nine of Gaza doctor's children, hospital says
content: A British surgeon working in Nasser Hospital said he had operated on the doctor's surviving 11-year-old.

title: Young US men are joining Russian churches promising 'absurd levels of manliness'
content: A religion with traditions dating back centuries is attracting young American men.

title: King's invite to Canada sends a message to Trump - and the world
content: Canada once downplayed the monarchy. Now, it is leaning on it to assert its sovereignty.

title: Victims in landmark child abuse trial ask why France doesn't want to know
content: The trial of France's most prolific known paedophile comes to an end this week amid widespread frustration.

title: From teenage Arsenal prodigy to convicted drug smuggler
content: As a young player, Jay Emmanuel-Thomas had the world at his feet. Where did it all go wrong?

title: 'It's not fair': Other refugees in limbo as US welcomes white South Africans
content: Refugees from other nations ask why the White House has made an exception for white South Africans.

title: Someone stole my BBC broadcasting bike - it's like losing a friend
content: Anna Holligan transformed her bike into a mobile studio for the BBC in the Netherlands - now it has vanished.

title: Sabotage suspected as power cut hits Cannes Film Festival
content: A substation was set on fire and a pylon damaged, interrupting screenings and affecting 160,000 homes.

title: DR Congo ex-leader lashes out after immunity lifted for treason charges
content: Joseph Kabila made the remarks in a 45-minute speech live on YouTube from an unspecified location.

title: Schumacher's 2001 Grand Prix-winning Ferrari sold for £13.43m
content: The Ferrari driven to victory by Formula One legend Michael Schumacher at the 2001 Monaco Grand Prix is sold for £13.43m at auction.

title: EU calls for 'respect' after Trump threatens 50% tariffs
content: Trade chief Maros Sefcovic said the EU is "ready to defend" its interests after Trump threatened 50% tariffs on the bloc.

title: Eighteen injured in Hamburg knife attack as woman arrested
content: A 39-year-old woman is understood to have acted alone with no "political motive", German police say.

title: Ugandan activist alleges she was raped while in Tanzanian detention
content: Tanzanian authorities are not commenting on the allegations, which include sexual assault.

title: King's big moment in Canada after Trump row
content: What's likely to be the message when King Charles makes a speech in Canada?

title: Robbery gang guilty of Kim Kardashian heist in Paris
content: The robbers have been given jail time for stealing millions of dollars' worth of jewellery belonging to the US celebrity.

title: Tensions rise as superpowers scrap for a piece of the Arctic
content: As Arctic ice melts, global powers seize new opportunities to extract oil, speed up trade and boost their military presence.

title: Hectic two weeks leaves Russia confident - and peace in Ukraine feeling no closer
content: On Ukraine peace talks, the Kremlin has played for time through deflections and side-steps, writes the BBC's Steve Rosenberg.

title: Rebuked by Trump but praised at home:  How Ramaphosa might gain from US showdown
content: The calm reaction of South Africa's president to the Oval Office ambush might boost his standing at home.

title: Her daughter was taken and sent abroad - 44 years later, they found each other
content: Hundreds made damning allegations of fraud, kidnapping and trafficking about an overseas adoption programme.

title: Can Donald Trump build the 'Golden Dome' over the US?
content: Experts believe that it will take decades and hundreds of billions of dollars to build the 'Golden Dome'.

title: 'We did not sign up for this': Harvard's foreign students are stuck and scared
content: Harvard has around 6,800 foreign students currently - a third are from China, and more than 700 are Indian.

title: On the South African road incorrectly identified as a 'burial site' by Trump
content: The US president said video of crosses on the road was evidence of the scale of attacks on white farmers.

title: The Bitcoin hum that is unsettling Trump's MAGA heartlands
content: Trump has said he wants to turn the US into the crypto-mining capital of the world - but that has real-world implications for many of his core voters

title: What we know about the Israeli embassy staff shooting
content: Police say the victims, a young couple, were shot by a man who shouted "free, free Palestine".

title: In South Korea, even your cup of Starbucks could be too political
content: All six presidential candidates' names are banned in Starbucks stores to "maintain neutrality".

title: How Trump-Ramaphosa confrontation went down in South Africa
content: Right-wing Afrikaners groups celebrated the ambush but others in the Rainbow Nation found it "uncomfortable" to watch.

title: The islanders facing China's menacing presence on their horizon
content: Pagasa is barely big enough for a plane to land, but it stands tall against an armada of Chinese ships.

title: How the mask slipped during US fugitive Nicholas Rossi's court saga
content: Unravelling the case of a US fugitive who claimed to be the victim of mistaken identity after being traced in Glasgow.

title: Jeremy Bowen: Goodwill running out as UK, France and Canada demand Israel end Gaza offensive
content: France, the UK and Canada are among nations that have sharpened their criticism of Israel's ground offensive.

title: Who are the winners and losers from the UK-EU agreement?
content: A deal between the UK and European Union (EU) has been agreed at a post-Brexit leaders summit in London.

title: Solving the mystery of a dinosaur mass grave at the 'River of Death'
content: A group of researchers have come to Pipestone Creek in Canada to figure out why thousands of dinosaurs are buried here.

title: BBC uncovers child sex abuse in South Africa's illegal mines
content: An investigation into the illicit mining sector reveals a world of child exploitation.

title: Watch: Suspected sabotage causes Cannes power cut 'meltdown'
content: The prestigious film festival was disrupted, about 160,000 homes were without power and businesses were left without power.

title: Watch officer of ship that crashed into garden fell asleep, police say
content: Police say the ship's watch officer admitted to being asleep during the incident in Norway.

title: Watch: 'I didn't hear anything' - man who woke to find cargo ship in garden
content: The 135m-ship (443ft) missed Johan Helberg's house in Norway by metres, but he didn't notice a thing.
